title: Here's a reading list of 20 articles on zero-shot and few-shot learning using pretrained language models, up to 2022
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** by Jacob Devlin et al
This foundational paper introduces BERT, a model that has been widely used for zero-shot and few-shot learning tasks
**"Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"** by Tom B. Brown et al
This paper presents GPT-3, demonstrating its capabilities in few-shot learning
**"T5: Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"** by Colin Raffel et al
T5 is a versatile model that can be used for zero-shot and few-shot learning across various NLP tasks
**"Unsupervised Cross-lingual Representation Learning at Scale"** by Alexis Conneau et al
This paper discusses XLM-R, a model that performs well in zero-shot cross-lingual tasks
**"Zero-Shot Text Classification with Generative Language Models"** by Yinfei Yang et al
The authors explore zero-shot text classification using generative models
**"Few-Shot Text Generation with Pattern-Exploiting Training"** by Jason Wei et al
This paper introduces PET, a method for improving few-shot text generation
**"Making Pre-trained Language Models Better Few-shot Learners"** by Tianyu Gao et al
The paper proposes LM-BFF, a method to enhance few-shot learning capabilities of language models
**"Zero-Shot Learning with Common Sense Knowledge Graphs"** by Antoine Bosselut et al
This work integrates common sense knowledge graphs with language models for zero-shot learning
**"Meta-Learning for Few-Shot Natural Language Processing: A Survey"** by Keqiang Wang et al
A comprehensive survey on meta-learning approaches for few-shot NLP tasks
**"Cross-lingual Zero-shot Neural Machine Translation with Multilingual Pretrained Models"** by Jiatao Gu et al
This paper explores zero-shot translation using multilingual pretrained models
**"Zero-Shot Learning for Semantic Utterance Classification"** by Xin Xu et al
The authors propose a zero-shot learning approach for classifying semantic utterances
**"Few-Shot Learning with Contextualized Word Vectors and Meta-Learning"** by Yu Zhang et al
This paper combines contextualized word vectors with meta-learning for few-shot tasks
**"Zero-Shot Learning with Pre-trained Language Models"** by Yinfei Yang et al
The authors discuss leveraging pretrained language models for zero-shot learning
**"Few-Shot Learning for Named Entity Recognition in Medical Text"** by Emily Alsentzer et al
This paper applies few-shot learning techniques to medical NER tasks
**"Zero-Shot Learning for Text Classification with Knowledge Graphs"** by Yujia Qin et al
The authors explore using knowledge graphs for zero-shot text classification
**"Few-Shot Learning with Sentence-Level Transformers"** by Alexey Dosovitskiy et al
This paper investigates the use of sentence-level transformers for few-shot learning
**"Zero-Shot Learning for Textual Data: A Survey"** by Zhi-Hong Deng et al
A survey on zero-shot learning techniques applied to textual data
**"Few-Shot Learning with Pre-trained Language Models"** by Yanan Zheng et al
The authors discuss methods to enhance few-shot learning with pretrained models
**"Zero-Shot Learning for Cross-Lingual Text Classification"** by Alexis Conneau et al
This paper explores zero-shot learning for cross-lingual text classification tasks
**"Few-Shot Learning for Dialogue Systems"** by Chia-Hsuan Lee et al
The authors apply few-shot learning techniques to improve dialogue systems
These articles cover a range of topics and approaches related to zero-shot and few-shot learning using pretrained language models, providing a comprehensive overview of the field up to
